description: From Middle English findiȝ, from Old English findiġ (“considerable, good, heavy”), perhaps of Old Norse origin. Compare Danish fyndig (“energetic, weighty”).

adjectives.description: findy (comparative more findy, superlative most findy)

entries.meaning: (dialectal or obsolete) full; heavy; firm; solid; substantial; plentiful
examples: A cold May and a windy makes the barn fat and findy. (old proverb)
